curam.util.ctm.bom
Interface PreCommitActionTypeBOM

All Superinterfaces:
BusinessObjectModule
All Known Implementing Classes:
ApplicationConfigPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, AppResourcePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, CodeTableHierarchyPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, CodeTablePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, CSSAppResourcePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, ImageAppResourcePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, PropertiesAppResourcePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, PropertiesPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, SchemaAppResourcePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, SectionConfigPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, SecurityGroupPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, SecurityIdentifierPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, SecurityRolePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, TabConfigPreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl, XMLAppResourcePreCommitActionTypeBOMImpl
public interface PreCommitActionTypeBOM
extends BusinessObjectModule

Business object types that require pre-commit actions that are applicable at a business object type level rather than at a business object instance level can provide customized implementations of this BOM. Note that this should not be confused with PreCommitActionBOM which is applicable at a business object instance level and that will be invoked for each business object instance for a given business object type. Because it is an optional BOM, it is not mandatory for every business object type to provide a customized implementation.

A change set apply operation runs within its own transaction. This BOM will be invoked during the 'apply' operation, but before the transaction is completed. So a BOM implementation can decide whether the apply operation should succeed or not based on various business conditions and can make the transaction to either commit or roll back.

Method Summary
 void preCommit(java.util.Set<BusinessObjectActionData> businessObjectActionDataSet)

Method Detail

preCommit

void preCommit(java.util.Set<BusinessObjectActionData> businessObjectActionDataSet)
               throws AppException,
                      InformationalException

Infrastructure will call this API method once for the given business object type. Since there can be multiple business object instances for a particular business object type , this method will be passed with a set of BusinessObjectActionData objects.

A typical BOM implementation is expected to write down business logic that is applicable at a business object type level and not at a business object instance level. Note that this method will be called before the transaction is completed during the change set 'apply' operation. Hence this method has the capability to commit or roll back the transaction based on various business decisions.

An out-of-the-box 'no-op' implementation will be provided for Business Object Types that do not require this functionality.

Parameters:
businessObjectActionDataSet - Set of BusinessObjectActionData that will contain business object identifier as well as the related information such as the 'Action' string and the Business object XML document fragment.
Throws:
AppException - Generic exception signature.
InformationalException - Generic exception signature.
